abstracts.cdata!:
Rating for the Mumbai Urban Transport
            Project for India were as follows: outcome was moderately
            satisfactory, risk to development outcomes was moderate,
            Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, Borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and monitoring and
            evaluation was modest. Some lessons learned included:
            Project development objectives should be specific and
            measurable. Large-scale resettlement is a complex operation
            that needs considerable planning,adequate provision of time,
            good negotiation skills, and strong capacity to implement
            successfully. A lack of adequate synchronization of
            resettlement activities with civil works cancause
            significant time and cost overruns.Transition from an
            administrative compensation approach to a win-win negotiated
            approach can resolve seemingly intractable problems with
            project-affected groups.Introducing entitlements and
            market-based solutions was a major contributor to
            resettlement success.
